glsa.title: Evolution: User-assisted remote execution of arbitrary code
glsa.synopsis: The IMAP client of Evolution contains a vulnerability potentially leading to the execution of arbitrary code.

background.p: Evolution is the mail client of the GNOME desktop environment. Camel is the Evolution Data Server module that handles mail functions.

description.p: The imap_rescan() function of the file camel-imap-folder.c does not properly sanitize the "SEQUENCE" response sent by an IMAP server before being used to index arrays.

impact.p: A malicious or compromised IMAP server could trigger the vulnerability and execute arbitrary code with the permissions of the user running Evolution.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All Evolution users should upgrade evolution-data-server to the latest version:
